images.summary: This image shows a wall and door schedule for the ground floor. The wall schedule includes four types of walls: W1 is a new wall with 5/8" Type X Drywall, 2x4 wood studs at 16" on center, R-20 Rockwool insulation, and a 6mil vapour barrier. W2 refers to existing interior partition walls with 2x4 wood studs at 16" on center, R-20 insulation, and 1/2" drywall. W3 describes an existing wall with 1/2" drywall, 2x6 wood studs at 16" on center, R-20 insulation, exterior sheathing, 1" air space, and 4" face brick. W4 is an existing wall with 1/2" Type X Drywall, 2x6 wood studs at 16" on center, R-20 insulation, and 5/8" stucco plywood siding with 6" batten boards. The door schedule lists SD as a 48" barn slider with one unit and BS as a 36" barn slider with two units.

images.summary: This plan illustrates the proposed ground floor layout, highlighting modifications such as new walls and steel beams. Key areas include the garage, dining room, living room, porch, laundry, hall, and informal living space. Wall types W1, W2, W3, and W4 are indicated throughout the plan, corresponding to the wall schedule. The plan provides detailed dimensions and specifications, enhancing the functionality and aesthetics of the ground floor.

images.summary: This image presents a wall and door schedule for the second floor. The wall schedule includes W1 as a new wall with 1/2" drywall, 2x4 wood studs at 16" on center, R-20 Rockwool insulation, and a 6mil vapour barrier. W2 refers to existing interior partition walls with 2x4 wood studs at 16" on center, R-20 insulation, and 1/2" drywall. W4 is an existing wall with 1/2" Type X Drywall, 2x6 wood studs at 16" on center, R-20 insulation, and 5/8" stucco plywood siding with 6" batten boards. The door schedule lists D as an existing door with three units, D3 as a 30" wide door with one unit, and BS as a 36" barn slider with one unit. The area is noted as 266 square feet with a San Marino natural finish.

images.summary: This plan illustrates the proposed second floor layout, featuring new walls and spaces such as an upper loft TV room, kids play area, sun deck, bar, existing fireplace, hall, master bedroom, and bedroom #3. Wall types W1, W2, and W4 are indicated throughout the plan, corresponding to the wall schedule. The plan provides detailed dimensions and specifications, enhancing the living space and functionality of the second floor.

images.text_verbatim:
BRICK VENEER
LAP AIR BARRIER OVER AND SEAL TO TRANSITION MEMBRANE AS SHOWN.
PEEL & STICK MEMBRANE TRANSITION STRIP OVER ANGLE. (TYP.)
1/2" dia. LAG BOLTS w/ 3" EMBED. INTO WOOD LINTEL @ 30" o.c. (FIRST BOLT 6" FROM EACH END). PROVIDE 1-1/2" VERTICALLY SLOTTED HOLE THROUGH ANGLE.
WEEP HOLES w/ MESH SCREEN @ 32" o.c.
PREFIN. METAL DRIP EDGE
STEEL ANGLE, PER PLAN. (TYP.)

LINTEL INSTALLATION NOTES:
1. SHORE LINTEL DURING BRICK INSTALLATION PLUS 7 DAYS AFTER COMPLETION.
2. 3-1/2" CLAY BRICK ONLY. HORIZONTAL LADDER IN FIRST 5 COURSES ABOVE
3. SOLID COURSE EXTEND 12" PAST DOOR JAMB. USE TYPE S MORTAR.
images.summary: This detail shows a wall section with brick veneer and various components. The brick veneer is supported by a steel angle, with a peel & stick membrane transition strip over the angle. Lag bolts with a 3" embedment into the wood lintel are spaced at 30" on center, with the first bolt 6" from each end. Weep holes with mesh screens are spaced at 32" on center. A prefinished metal drip edge is included. Lintel installation notes specify shoring during brick installation and 7 days after, use of 3-1/2" clay brick with horizontal ladder in the first 5 courses above, and a solid course extending 12" past the door jamb using Type S mortar. The detail provides essential information for the installation of the wall system.
